newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway T-bill auction gets 3.55 pct high yield.
newsitem.headline: Norway T-bill auction gets 3.55 pct high yield.

text.p: Norway's Central Bank said on Monday that a 3.0 billion crown expansion of a treasury bill known as SS43 produced a highest yield of 3.55 percent with a 61 percent allotment.
The lowest yield at the ordinary auction was 3.50 percent and the weighted average came to 3.53 percent, the bank said.
The T-bill has a nominal interest rate of 4.80 percent and matures on June 18.
The bank does not provide figures for the total amount of money in the bill, which was issued last June and expanded by three billion crowns ($462.2 million) last August. ($ = 6.490 Norwegian Crowns)
